message.body: Hi
Hi. Looking forward to the long weekend?
Yes! Going home, haven't seen my family in so long. Hbu?
Do you have plans for through weekend?
Nothing too specific. Probably some kayaking, but no major travel. How far do you have to go to see the fam?
Kayaking? That sounds awesome. I've always wanted to, but I'm not that adventurous lol Im a student at u of m my family also lives in Michigan not too fa
r, an hour and a halfs drive but we get so caught up with things then suddenly its been months since you've seen your family
Yeah, sometimes it's easier to schedule if you're farther away. You have to plan more.
I'm on the opposite coast from my family now.
Where's home for you?
Current home is Philly, fam is in oregon, where I grew up.
Oh nice, Philly is a long ways from Oregon. What made you decide to live in Philly if you don't mind me asking. Work? School?
I'm Sudanese, spent most of my life btween here and Sudan. And still, never been outside of Michigan.
I moved here for work. I moved around before that for quirk and school, but mostly stuck to the west coast.
So what are you hobbies, interests. What do you do for fun?
I like to read, kayak, walk/hike. What about you?
I'm not really that outdoorsy, I wish I were though lol I read, I work a lot with refugees/asylum and new immigrants and human rights and that not so I d
o a ton of volunteering.
But I absolutely love nature. In free time I love to take long walks to just clear my head or just sit by the lake sometimes and enjoy the peace. Sounds
a bit boring I know but with a good book or the right people it can be an amazing experience.
I'm all for enjoying the peace!
You said you're a student. What are you studying?
Currently a senior double majoring in political science and global health. I'm really interested in public health and medicine. But I have a long ways t
o go, a masters in public health and an md and phd ahead of me.
I'm the oldest in my family and fist to attend university and in our culture thibgs are so different. there's a certain pressure to accomplish everything
. So I have to live up to family expectations in a way.
Which is why my favorite thing to do is break free and take my long walks and enjoy the peace and serenity of nature.
Sounds like you have a lot of ambition, but also an appreciation for having some balance.
Having been through a phd myself, I can tell you having that sense of balance will help
Yes, I guess you can say I'm ambitious, my dream job is to be director of WHO. But I want no personal or financial gain out of life. I was taught to appr
eciate my blessings and live a simple life. So all this is just simply my way of giving back really.
Growing up most of my childhood was spent in my grandparents village, with no running water, daily power outages lasting 16 hours a time, and living on a
dollar a day. Teaches you to really appreciate the small things. :)
Wow! I wish you well in your endeavors. I guess your experiences would definitely give you a much different perspective than most people in this country!
Lol thank you. Much appreciated. What is your Phd in?
Linguistics. I started as an english major and then went into teaching english as a second language for my masters.
That meant taking linguistics classes and I totally fell in love with the subject
English major, I initially thought about it, but a triple major and a minor sounds a bit much. Lol one of my dreams is to one day become a published auth
or, travel to third world countries and write books on the people and stories I encounter!
What do you do for a living now? Do you work in academia?
I'm in semi-academia. Not a professor, but still involved in research.
